metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29824 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In libxml2 before 2.9.14, several buffer handling functions in buf.c (xmlBuf*) and tree.c (xmlBuffer*) don't check for integer overflows. This can result in out-of-bounds memory writes. Exploitation requires a victim to open a crafted, multi-gigabyte XML file. Other software using libxml2's buffer functions, for example libxslt through 1.1.35, is affected as well.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.6
libxml2-utils - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.6
python-libxml2 - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.6
python3-libxml2 - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.6').
